intro: Solanum luteoliflorum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, round berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in moist, temperate climates. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
